div.sent: Man has been curious about the motion of stars and planets since ancient time.
Danish astronomer Tycho Brahe observed the motion of planets and stars for long twenty years and gathered a lot of information about them.
He left the information with a German astronomer Johannes Kepler at the time of his death.
Kepler analysed the facts left by Tycho Brahe (1606- 1619) and formulated some laws for explaining the motion of planets around the sun.
But he did not explain the causes of such motion.
From his laws we know how planets move round the sun but he could not explain why.
The reason behind motion was explained by a British scientists, Sir lssac Newton, through his law of gravitation.
At that time an apple fell down on earth.
He questioned himself, Why did the apple fall down instead of going upward or staying still?
He thought, the reason could be that the earth attracted the apple towards it with a certain force.
The earth attracts bodies near its surface and bodies around.
For this reason anything thrown upward from the earth comes down ultimately to its surface.
This idea of earth's attraction to bodies surrounding it was a revolutionary one.
He discovered that the force of earth extends upto the vast outer space.
That isevery substance of this universe attractsevery other substance.
There is a force of mutual attraction that exists betweenbodies in the universe.
This force is known as gravitation.
This is a universal force.
With the idea of gravitation he explained how planets move round the fixed orbits and the moon revolves around the earth.
There aremany stars like sun in the universe.
Gravitational force makes them fixed to their own orbits so thatthey cannot go out of their path and make ollisions with others.
Any two bodies in this universe attract each other with a force along a line connecting the centres of them.
This force depends on the mass of these attracting bodies.
The more massive they are the more is the force.
Bodies of smaller masses have smaller force.
Gravitational force depends on the distance between the attracting bodies.
Force increases for greater distance and decreases for smaller distance.
Newton was only 23 years old when he discovered gravitation in Gravitational force is a very weak force.
Only for the massive bodies likethe sun and the earth this force can be felt.
According to his theory, gravitational force on the surface of the sun, planet or satellite depends on its mass and radius (taken them as spheres).
So the gravitational force of the sun will be much greater, about 28 times, than that of the earth.
Therefore, the gravitational force of the moon will be much smaller, about 1/6th of that of the earth.
Gravity is the force of attraction between the earth and any other body.
We see from Newton's theory that, any two bodies in this universe attract each other.
When one of the attracting bodies is the earth, the force is called gravity.
So gravity is a special case of gravitation.
The earth attracts every other body on its surface.
Each body itself is attracting the earth towards it.
Earth is attracting you toward it; you also at the same time attracting the earth with the same force toward you.
When you jump upwards you and the earth mutually attract each other.
But you don't find the earth coming towards you; rather you come back on the earth surface.
The reason is that the earth is much more heavier than you and so it stays where it is but you come down on it.
In reality we see bodies on or near the earth surface are much smaller in mass than the earth.
So they all fall on the surface of the earth when they are thrown vertically upwards.
So you see that it is the gravity that makes ripe fruits fall down from trees.
We can walk on the surface of earth due to gravity.
When you go upstairs against gravity you breathe quickly and feel tired.
And the most important thing is that gravity makes atmosphere stay around the earth.
If there were no gravity, there would be no atmosphere to breathe.
So there would be no man and animal to live on earth.
Our existence on this earth is the outcome of gravity.
Let a body fall freely.
Before starting to fall the body has no velocity.
Its velocity increases every second as it starts falling.
The rate at which velocity of a body increases is known as acceleration.
This acceleration is caused by the force of gravity.
It is, therefore, known as acceleration due to gravity.
It is represented by g.
The value of acceleration due to gravity is fixed at a certain place but changes from place to place.
The average value of g on the earth surface is taken as 9.8 meter per second square.
It means that a freely falling body has a velocity of 9.8 m/sec. .
As you go up above the surface of the earth, the value of g decreases.
Again the value of g also decreases below the earth surface.
The value of g at the centre of the earth is zero.
In the equatorial region this value is the lowest and in the polar region this value is the highest.
This is due to the fact that our earth is not a perfect sphere; it is slightly flat at the north and south poles.
The distance of the equator from the centre of the earth is greater than the distance of the poles.
Mass: The total quantity of the matter in a body is called its mass.
Mass is a fundamental property of a body.
Mass is measured with balance.
The S.I. unit of mass is kilogram kg.
Mass of a body does not change.
Anywhere on the earth surface, bellow or above, mass of a substance remains the same.
If your mass is 40kg on earth, it will be 40 kg if you go to the moon.
Weight is a force and that is why the units of weight and force are the same.
We know that S.I unit of force is Newton.
So the muri container exerts 9.8 Newton force and the rice container exerts 49 Newton force, which is five times greater.
We see that weight depends on acceleration due to gravity and its value is not the same everywhere.
So the weight of a body varies from place to place.
The value of g is the highest on earth surface.
Weight is also maximum here.
That means on mountain top or inside a mine the body weight of any object will be less than its weight on the surface.
The value of g is zero at the centre of the earth.
Now, if you go to the centre of the earth and weigh these things there, the weight of them will be zero.
A body weighs more in the Polar Regions and less in equatorial regions but its mass remains the same everywhere.
By ordinary balance we measure mass, not the weight.
Weight is measured by spring balance.
When a body is released from above, it comes down due to the force of gravity.
He performed the experiment at the leaning tower of Pisa in Italy.
The tower was 54.86 metre high and from the roof of the tower he let bodies of different masses fall at the same time.
The light bodies took a bit longer time than the heavy ones to reach the ground.
It was due to the fact that the light bodies faced more obstructions from air fiction and its upward pressure.
Had there been no obstructions from air, both the heavy and the light objects would fall at the same time.
Later, Newton proved the truth by an experiment known as Guinea and Feather Experiment.
The guinea and the feather reached the bottom of the tube at the same time.
